intro: Tarenna quocensis var. quocensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds.
